segments.pli: “Chahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu abhabbo aggaṃ dhammaṃ arahattaṃ sacchikātuṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, a mendicant with six qualities can’t realize the best thing, perfection.

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu assaddho hoti, ahiriko hoti, anottappī hoti, kusīto hoti, duppañño hoti, kāye ca jīvite ca sāpekkho hoti.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant is faithless, shameless, imprudent, lazy, and witless. And they’re concerned with their body and their life.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu abhabbo aggaṃ dhammaṃ arahattaṃ sacchikātuṃ.
segments.en: A mendicant with these six qualities can’t realize the best thing, perfection.

segments.pli: Chahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu bhabbo aggaṃ dhammaṃ arahattaṃ sacchikātuṃ.
segments.en: A mendicant with six qualities can realize the best thing, perfection.

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu saddho hoti, hirīmā hoti, ottappī hoti, āraddhavīriyo hoti, paññavā hoti, kāye ca jīvite ca anapekkho hoti.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant is faithful, conscientious, prudent, energetic, and wise. And they have no concern for their body and their life.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu bhabbo aggaṃ dhammaṃ arahattaṃ sacchikātun”ti.
segments.en: A mendicant with these six qualities can realize the best thing, perfection.”
